titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of the History of Chemistry records 1960-2003 1970s-1990s
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of the History of Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of the History of Chemistry is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. The division encourages research and scholarship, presents awards for major achievements in the chemical sciences, and interacts with other organizations interested in the history of science.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records gathered from various members of the ACS Division of the History of Chemistry. Records include: Executive Committee minutes and reports; History Division reports; documents from the Nominating Committee; membership directories and cards; program and symposium materials; documents relating to the Outstanding Paper and Dexter Awards; a small set of documents on the CHEM Study project; financial records; 1985 to 1993 National Meeting Cachets (commemorative envelopes with informational cards); documents from the Committee on Divisional Activities; and by-laws and miscellaneous administrative materials.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
